intro: Plumeria papuana, commonly known as the Papuan frangipani, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, including Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that come in shades of white, yellow, and pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, waxy leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects, making it an important part of the local ecosystem.
